intro: Iberidella andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's iberidella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
